definition:
The *Alexandrov one-point compactification* of a non-compact topological
space $X$ is obtained by adjoining a new point $\infty$ and defining the
topology on $X\cup\{\infty\}$ to consist of the open sets of $X$
together with the sets of the form $U\cup\{\infty\}$, where $U$ is an
open subset of $X$ with compact complement.

With this topology, $X\cup\{\infty\}$ is always compact. Furthermore, it
is Hausdorff if and only if $X$ is Hausdorff and locally compact.
